definition: sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: He that would live in peace and rest must hear and see, and say the best.
sentences.chinese: 要想太安寧平，生活安定，必須耳聰目明，善言入耳。

sentences.english: Wearing this audiovisual device, you are aBle to see and hear clearly.
sentences.chinese: 戴上這種視聽器，您就會耳聰目明。

sentences.english: But the giraffe has good sight, hearing, and smell to warn it of danger.
sentences.chinese: 但是，長頸鹿耳聰目明，嗅覺靈敏，使它能提防危險。

definition: lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to whisper to one another's ear
feng shui master/geomancer/stock figure in folk tales, as a wise adviser or a charlatan
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
